content.rendered:
Today is Work Like a Dog Day. And though there are no prescribed ways to celebrate, here are a few ideas:

  • Work harder than you would normally work. Don’t just bark orders, work. Work hard in honor of those who normally put 100% effort into all that they do.
  • Work like a dog: that is, take a nap, lie in the shade or on the couch. A hammock works great, too.
  • Give your service dog a day off or, perhaps, a special treat.
  • Take your dog to a dog park.
    Take yourself to a dog park and let your dog come along.
  • If you don’t have a dog, maybe it’s time to get one. There is probably a local pet adoption agency that you can contact in order to find a dog.
  • Borrow someone else’s dog for the day. Maybe you have a friend or a relative who wouldn’t mind letting you borrow his or her dog for the day. The two of you can go for a walk, take naps together or, maybe, go for a swim at the lake.

Whatever you decided to do, enjoy. If you take one of my suggestions or come up with one of your own, please let me know.
